_0.description: The current working directory of the executed program or script. If omitted Code's current workspace root is used.

_1.description: The environment of the executed program or shell. If omitted the parent process' environment is used.

_3.errorMessage: Unrecognized problem matcher. Is the extension that contributes this problem matcher installed?

_5.description: The name of a base problem matcher to use.

_6.description: The owner of the problem inside Code. Can be omitted if base is specified. Defaults to 'external' if omitted and base is not specified.

_7.description: A human-readable string describing the source of this diagnostic, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'.

_8.description: The default severity for captures problems. Is used if the pattern doesn't define a match group for severity.

_9.description: Controls if a problem reported on a text document is applied only to open, closed or all documents.

anyOf.description: The name of a contributed or predefined pattern

_10.description: A problem pattern or the name of a contributed or predefined problem pattern. Can be omitted if base is specified.

_11.description: Defines how file names reported in a problem pattern should be interpreted. A relative fileLocation may be an array, where the second element of the array is the path of the relative file location. The search fileLocation mode, performs a deep (and, possibly, heavy) file system search within the directories specified by the include/exclude properties of the second element (or the current workspace directory if not specified).

_12.description: Patterns to track the begin and end of a matcher active on a background task.

activeOnStart.description: If set to true the background monitor starts in active mode. This is the same as outputting a line that matches beginsPattern when the task starts.

beginsPattern.description: If matched in the output the start of a background task is signaled.

endsPattern.description: If matched in the output the end of a background task is signaled.

_13.deprecationMessage: The watching property is deprecated. Use background instead.
_13.description: Patterns to track the begin and end of a watching matcher.

activeOnStart.description: If set to true the watcher starts in active mode. This is the same as outputting a line that matches beginsPattern when the task starts.

beginsPattern.description: If matched in the output the start of a watching task is signaled.

endsPattern.description: If matched in the output the end of a watching task is signaled.

_14.deprecationMessage: This property is deprecated. Use the watching property instead.

password.description: Controls if a password input is shown. Password input hides the typed text.

enumDescriptions: The 'pickString' type shows a selection list.

options.description: An array of strings that defines the options for a quick pick.

_88.patternErrorMessage: 'env.', 'config.' and 'command.' are deprecated, use 'env:', 'config:' and 'command:' instead.

regexp.description: The regular expression to find an error, warning or info in the output.

kind.description: whether the pattern matches a location (file and line) or only a file.

file.description: The match group index of the filename. If omitted 1 is used.

location.description: The match group index of the problem's location. Valid location patterns are: (line), (line,column) and (startLine,startColumn,endLine,endColumn). If omitted (line,column) is assumed.

line.description: The match group index of the problem's line. Defaults to 2

column.description: The match group index of the problem's line character. Defaults to 3

endLine.description: The match group index of the problem's end line. Defaults to undefined

endColumn.description: The match group index of the problem's end line character. Defaults to undefined

severity.description: The match group index of the problem's severity. Defaults to undefined

code.description: The match group index of the problem's code. Defaults to undefined

message.description: The match group index of the message. If omitted it defaults to 4 if location is specified. Otherwise it defaults to 5.

loop.description: In a multi line matcher loop indicated whether this pattern is executed in a loop as long as it matches. Can only specified on a last pattern in a multi line pattern.

regexp.description: The regular expression to detect the begin or end of a background task.

file.description: The match group index of the filename. Can be omitted.

_93.description: The shell command to be executed. Array items will be joined using a space character

enumDescriptions: Marks the task as a build task accessible through the 'Run Build Task' command.
Marks the task as a test task accessible through the 'Run Test Task' command.
Assigns the task to no group

isDefault.description: Defines if this task is the default task in the group, or a glob to match the file which should trigger this task.

_96.description: The input's id is used to associate an input with a variable of the form ${input:id}.

_97.description: The description is shown when the user is prompted for input.

_98.description: The default value for the input.
